title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: November 14
body:
Hi folks,
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get delayed or even stopped. If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler


http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/6.24.1/img/champion/Ziggs.png      
----------------------------------------------------------------------------      
**Updated Run Animations**   

We've currently got some work underway to improve the run animation of some of our older champions. We're targeting champs who either aren't in need of a full VGU or aren't likely to get one in the immediate future. Walk/Run anims are being focused on here since they're played more than any other animations, so you generally get the largest improvement in overall feel for a single animation upgrade. 

With the new anims we're looking to further convey the personality and character of a champion. We're also prioritizing keeping the essence of what's iconic though and looking to build on it, make sure people playing these champs still relate to movements they know and love. In some cases we'll also be using both new and old animations in different contexts (e.g. old anim as regular run new as haste run, new anim while a specific ability is active, new anim as pre boots run etc). 

Compilation of the proposed new runs done so far below. We're still working on these, so it's an ideal time for feedback, whether here, on Twitter, the various LoL art forums or wherever. Still a little while off shipping them, will likely get them onto the PBE for an extended period soon though so you can also get hands on experience with them if desired.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9256uqY-kNM

----------------------------------------------------------------------------         
**End of the Ranked Season**

The 2018 ranked season has just come to an end. Hope it treated you well if you took part! As you've probably seen we've got a range of changes planned for ranked in 2019. Couple of recent videos talking about a lot of that for anyone that missed them:

New Tiers and Changes to Placements:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jxt2Z4hEjwE

Rewards and Ranked Splits:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UDvRhUyHsKA

Ranked is very much a system we're still working on. We've made a range of changes since we first started talking about this stuff in April and we think we're in a good spot to get the system onto the live servers. We're going to keep iterating on it further though. Feedback on what's working for you and what's not still extremely appreciated as a result, that will help us improve it further.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------          
**Regular Balance changes and preseason**

When we do larger systemic changes like those in preseasons we see some champs who previously needed balance work end up in a pretty balanced state and others who were previously ok needing changes. As a result we'll be holding off on almost all balance work until we've seen where 8.23 puts champ power levels, then reacting to the new state of things. 8.23 will be a light patch balance wise as a result.

Most of these walk animations are completely on point.

I'd like to talk about Fiora though. The animation that the video ends with (as a walking animation) is perfect. Poised, in a fencing stance (an upright variant closer to the posture you use when saluting an opponent, but still), and appropriate. The running animation, however, needs a second set of eyes. As a fencer myself, that sort of bouncing motion is anathema to what you want to do -- you want to stay as level an in control as possible in most situations.

Now, I know Fiora isn't a traditional fencer (she lacks the standard stance and forward/backward walk, favoring a more upright, cross-step focused position), but I'm positive that no expert swordswoman would have that sort of bounce to her run while still trying to keep her blade level at an opponent. About the only time you'd run blade-forward is if you're doing [a fleche attack](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PXLeUSS2G_A), and that's typically rather close range.

I really think that, if Fiora's running and not in combat or in a dueling stance, that blade may need to drop, and that cross-step should change to normal running. A dueling stance is intended for fighting, not for covering long distances quickly, and I think Fiora would realize that you can't really run with a full blade extension and expect it to work out for you, nor use a cross-step (intended to cover longer distances but still within reasonable range) for extended movement.

I love this comment, and I thought the same thing about the change of stance in combat. Similar to when Aatrox readies his passive bonus, Fiora should pick up the fencing stance only when she’s near an enemy or in combat. The normal run looks more suited for non-combat situations.

Wait you mean that Pantheon and Mundo pizza feet is less important issue to fix than these running annimations? I mean Pantheon and Mundo could use a mini VU till they get reworked and look at the very least 2018 champions not like they came from Pacman era ( in contrast with the newer champions).

We're looking at run animation updates in part because animations can be upgraded one at a time. With things like model changes you need to change the whole model (can't just shrink the feet and get a good result). Changing the model substnatially without adjusting the rig (skeleton animations use) and animations often doesn't create a good result either. It's not a trade off of give some champs better runs versus fix pizza feet as a result, scale of work's just really different. 

Panth and Mundo are also both substantially higher up the VGU tier list than the champs being worked on here.

Can't believe I made it here this early being from the UK but I have a question about pre-season.  How are the statblocks in runes different from before you reworked runes last season.  Weren't you trying to get rid of stat blocks so things outside of the game would be more accessible to new players?

We didn't want to remove stats entirely from the pre-game, hence Rune trees bringing stats with them. Our original thinking was that binding stats to trees would create more interesting choices as you made trade offs between things like the keystone you most wanted with your second choice of stats versus less optimal keystone that came with optimal stats. Overall that hasn't worked as we'd hoped. It does offer some theoretically interesting trade offs, but also results in a lot of feel bad, perception of lack of options and to some degree just straight up lack of options. 

From a new player perspective the biggest thing we wanted to address was a substantial difference in power between new players and accounts with full runes/masteries. We design and balance with the expectation players have full pre-game power, so that was just leading to a worse experience for people trying to get into the game.

{{champion:43}} 

Meddler, I still cannot believe all of you think this rework is going to be a successful approach to Karma. You are really going through with this rework, aren't you? Karma's new rework is exactly the same problems her VGU/relaunch accomplished and that is half completed and poorly thought out. The relaunch/VGU 5 years ago didn't solve any of Karma's problems and the rework was a great excuse to actually tackle that. I do not understand how and why you think this kit is a successful approach to Karma when she has hardly any skill expression, is unique in herself, and gives her a gameplay identity. These changes just further the distance between Karma being a unique and better champion to one that is overpowered with number buffs and powerful Mantra. The point of a gameplay identity and unique abilities is to offer players a specific playstyle with that champion. Karma's Mantra abilities are enhanced basic abilities that lack really any uniqueness. Half of Karma's abilities and Manta abilities exist on other champions and item actives.

Giving Karma the new Mantra W mechanic doesn't fit her thematically and suits a champion like Zilean more. You have tried reworks like this on other champions where you give them one overpowered mechanic in their kit and buff their damage, to have that champion be dumpster into oblivion because you are not actually addressing their problems. What are you doing to add more skill expression and a gameplay identity by front loading more damage into Karma's only blocked damage move? What are you doing to add more skill expression and gameplay identity to a new ally mechanic with Mantra W that benefits a Mage, when that is actually the only new concept on Karma in the rework? What are you doing to add more skill expression to Mantra E so that is doesn't promote Karma to sit in the backline and shield, but also have the ability be unique that doesn't exist already on another champion or item active?

I'm tired of hearing about how this is just something small to hold her over when you can work on her. I am tired of hearing about how Developers will rework her abilities in the moderate future. I am tired of being promised a revert but get a rework that is one sided towards new Karma players and Support. I am tied of seeing a champion with nothing unique on her and only gets rehashed abilities from champions that were removed for a reason. You have literally tried everything possible on this kit with numbers buff, increase strength on Mantra, increasing CC, reworking certain abilities, and more. THE KIT IS NOT WORKING MEDDLER AND THE PROBLEM IS SHE HAS NO SKILL EXPRESSION IN HER MANTRA OR A GAMEPLAY IDENTITY. For the past 5 years you guys have done nothing but give us false promises and take everything away. Everything you have literally done is cater to one player. There are mage and old Karma mains and they are being neglected. I don't care how much power you put into her only damage move. Karma's problem was never being able to dish out damage. The problem with Karma has always been her not having enough damage options, skill expression on Mantra or a gameplay identity.

---------------

Solve the problems:

1) Separate Karma's strengths by what she builds. Riot Game Developers created the massive divide between Karma players. There will always be one side whining about how another one is being catered to and you are not tackling the problems. If a Karma player builds Support itemization their ally mechanics and shields/heal will be stronger. If the Karma builds more AP than her damage of Mantra and abilities will be stronger.

2) Give every single Mantra a mage and support mechanic. Meaning Mantra Q healing explosion that is ground targeted. Remove the healing on Mantra W for more damage but also give her an ally mechanic that can be used on allies. Completely rework the concept of Mantra E and give us a damage component on it (it doesn't have to be shield bomb. It can be something different as long as there is a damage component on it.) You can give us shields that redirect damage back at opponents. You can give us an ability that destroys shields on the battlefield. You can literally do anything on Karma that would be more unique for Karma than a Mantra E that already exists on champions in several capacities and two item actives.

-----------------

LOOK I GAVE KARMA A GAMEPLAY IDENTITY. It was so hard Meddler. It's basically 2019 Meddler and it will be 6 years since the Kama relaunch/VGU. It is a massive failure on every level. We are not expecting a VGU anytime soon. We expect a work ethic that is at least able to tackle problems with Karma's problems that her original work didn't even improve. It will be 5 years in the making and you still haven't done anything on this champion. Your excuses no longer matter. Your company removed abilities and gameplay identity abilities that made her a better champion and you could have built upon. The functionality of her Mantra and skill expression of her Mantra are being neglected again. You could actually give her a gameplay identity and rework her abilities so that it doesn't cater to one side of the Karma playerbase. You created the divide. The complaining and negative comments are not going to stop until you make an active effort to rectify mistakes. You don't have to bring back Karma's fans, Shield Bomb, clothesline tether or anything else on her. You are supposed to be making the champion better for all players that decide to main her. This rework is not going to do anything other than what the reverted class updates are doing and how you are treating certain champions right now. I don't care. It is 2018 and almost 2019, Meddler. You should be doing a better job. You spent 4 to 5 months on Ahri and Lux. You have given Ryze almost 7 VGU/reworks. You prioritized a mini VGU on Ezreal when you are aware of work that needs to be done on champions like Skarner, Karma, and Morde. I do not understand why you are continuing to be so ignorant about specific champions problems and not actually working on them.

Hi! I have a comment about the Viktor walk animation.
I think that it would have been thematic and appropriate for a champion like old Swain, who needed a powerful walk, but for Viktor it just feels odd.
No matter what version of the lore you look at, he's a man on a mission to save the world. The vibe his walk animation gives off is a man ready to dominate the world (a la Doctor Doom), which not only makes him feel... evil, I'd say, but too _heavy_. Viktor's augments are supposed to be superior to normal flesh and blood, but the way he walks in this animation almost feels as if he needs his staff to keep him upright.
(Speaking of the staff, it's a little too short to be used in the fashion it's animated for. It's also more of a weapon than a walking aide, so I feel as though Viktor probably wouldn't use it in that way.)

One thing that I noticed in many of the animations (Karma stands out as well) is how much bounce or energy the animator likes to put into walk cycles. This works well for some energetic or silly champions, like Shaco, but it gives the wrong ideas for champions like Karma, Viktor, LeBlanc, and Fiora. In Karma's case, the mantle shouldn't float around as much to the left and right - up and down, perhaps. It just distracts from her as it bobs around. LeBlanc's cross-leg stride looks much more like something you'd see on the runway than the battlefield - she may be a prideful woman who knows _exactly_ what she's capable of, but crossing your legs like that is killer on the hips and your balance. (I'd tone it down, maybe put more sway in the shoulders.) Comments on Fiora have already been made (I agree with The Djinn!), so it's back to Viktor...
Viktor has way too much movement in the shoulders. His third arm and, by extension, the pauldron need to remain much steadier _especially_ since he can cast Death Ray while running. If his arm bounces around that much, I doubt his laser would fire in a straight line.

What I'd recommend for the walk animation is something a lot closer to his current one on live. I'd probably shorten the stride, put Viktor's back more upright, and make sure to keep his (dare I say cool, if not iconic?) cape flapping in the wind. Viktor is someone who has augmented himself past the average human, giving him more strength and grace than any flesh-and-blood citizen of Valoran. All I see in the new animation is brutish strength.

New Fiora run animation looks cool, but it's just waaayyyy too unnatural. Speaking as Fiora main. I can see it working if it's in combat only or something like that but the old one looks way better if we're talking about just covering distance. However I think giving her separate run animations in different situations is really risky, because Fiora is likely the only champion in the game on whom running around is a huge part of the mechanics (positioning to hit vitals), therefore I'd rather you guys decided to keep the old animations as is, or look for something in between maybe.
